turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: How do we follow a raven we can't even see?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Send Oona up above the tree tops. She be our eyes.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Good plan that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is ogre's magic.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Blackheart?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  He's enchanted the lot of them.  His reward for delivering the unicorn.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Foul fellow, this Couer de Noir.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The foulest.  Mayhap I can cut them free.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Jack, don't!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Worse than the battlefield.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What know you of fields of war?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Ofttimes, the wee folk come out to tend the wounded... staunch bleeding with cobwebs... give a parched mouth a sip of dew... cool a fevered brow...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There... it seems to quit... I'll wager that war held other attractions quite apart from nursing.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well... if the knight be already dead; what harm is there in... borrowing a thing or two?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stealing his arms?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oona tells me the raven has roosted for the night on a sharp stone spire some half a mile distance.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: That would be Devil's Needle.  Last landmark I know in these woods.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Beyond Devil's Needle, all is unknown.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Twould appear other travelers precede us.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Nay, Jack, tis not what you're thinking.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I trust our own welcome will be more hospitable.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Jack, Jack, it's dwarves live here. Hard-working chaps.  Hammering in the forge all the live-long day. Make the most wondrous things, they do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And this?  Some of their handiwork?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Nay.  That's but to distract the casual visitor.  A dwarf is too busy to suffer fools gladly.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Better to kill than be disturbed.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Your imagination runs away with you, Jack... Those bones be but battlefield gleanings, like I mentioned.  A wee bit of carrion to frighten off the uninvited.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here is a bold champion's reward; to serve as a dwarf's doorstop.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice piece of work.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Pure gold it is... plays a different note every time.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My God!  Look!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Something the matter?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ogg's footprints!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Shhh!  Not so loud, mayhap he'll hear ye.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Dwarves be very sensitive about their feet.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Certainly understandable.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Very secretive, they are.  Keep their feet covered up.  Best if you don't mention it.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I should hope not!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Gump, you're putting words in my mouth.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I pray always to be worthy of it.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Stoutly spoke, lad.  These dwarves be sore grouches... Pay no heed to their spiteful grumbling.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Don't let this talk of heroes upset you, Jack.  Sigurd's sword is no great thing.  The Volsung killed Fafnir.  You killed Lindfarne. That's one worm apiece... I'd say you and Sigurd were neck-and-neck.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're not in a tournament, Gump.  Ah, but a sword twice tempered in the blood of living dragons...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Tis not the sword that counts, but the man what swings it.  Rest easy, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: God protect you, Honeythorn Gump.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Your strong right arm's all the protection I'll need this night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Make haste!  We've a hard day's march ahead.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Be gentle with them, Jack.  They only march to please you.  Were this a faerie journey, we'd ride the wind on thistledown and ragwort stems.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: ... this rate... we'll all be in our graves... 'fore we reach the Baron's fortress...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll surely be in our graves if we don't.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Going grows slower... we've not made... half a mile in two hours...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: God's blessing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's the way, mates.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: What make ye of that, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It bodes evil.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Willful creature, that one...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Archers!  Bring down that spider! I'll deal with this other creature...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Stay on your guard, Jack.  The bug is enchanted surely.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Is she... dead?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, thank the Lord, but she be sore envenomed by the spider's bite.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: We're blind now.  Oona was our eyes and ears.  How do we find the Castle Couer de Noir without her?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll find it.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Easily said... the raven passed this way hours ago.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Heading true north.  We continue in that direction.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Never knowing when it takes a turn or changes course.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll trust in faith, Gump.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye, lad... we've little else to go by.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why not admit it, Honeythorn Gump. We've lost our way entirely.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Long as we don't lose heart, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll never find the Baron's castle.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Once you thought we'd never find the Greek's armor and look at ye now, decked out like a proper hero.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Wait, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nay.  This time we strike first!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Hold, Jack!  Don't strike!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nay.  I show no pity to imps and fiends.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I know the rogue, Jack.  Tis Jimmy Squarefoot.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  We be on a quest to set the world aright --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But seem to have gotten lost on the way.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can we trust him?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: No... but what choice have we?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Never felt so cold in all me born days...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The chill is worse this night.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Don't like the feel of it, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's your own fear troubles you... We're here, aren't we?  For all the dark magic protecting it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Give in to despair and all is lost.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: It feels wrong, Jack... like a trap.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's more than one way to spring a trap.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye, so long as you're not too greedy for the bait.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: That be so, better you pinch yourself now, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: On the morrow I'll be awake enough to see if dreams come true.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Pray they don't turn out to be nightmares.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Tells you something 'bout him what lives there...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We'll need more siege machinery and longer scaling ladders.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Why not mine the damned walls?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We do both.  Our frontal attack a diversion whilst we drive a tunnel under...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: A fine mess this is... horrid, nipping creatures... What do we now, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Defend ourselves.  We've bested far worse already.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Easily spoken...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't loose heart... Assemble the archers.  Have everyone not holding a shield man a bow.  Shoot the damned things as they fly.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: There aren't enough arrows.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never mind.  Just do it!  Retrieve the arrows somehow.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Water doesn't burn...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: And frog don't fly and bite like tomcats.  It be magic, Jack... powerful ogre's magic.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There isn't much time!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Been telling you that all along, lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What magic have we on our side?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Faerie magic's no match for a sorcerer's power... We have Ogg's gifts, the key and the --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's it!  The unbreakable line! We'll tie it to an arrow and fire it up into the timbers above the portculis... then, I'll climb up and chop down the drawbridge.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Will you chance a miss?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There must be some way to get it up there.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: One more turn...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: That's it!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Have the engineers corrected for alignment and trajectory?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Aye.  Before the wee pesties attacked.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then it's Godspeed, Screwball.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Fire away!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He'll be atop the portculis ere long.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Best get down close to the moat, lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  We're good as inside.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: It's what we'll find there worries me.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Jack!  The courtyard's been taken... The Baron's forces are besieged in the south tower.  No sign of... Jack?  Do you hear what I'm saying? We've won, lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Nonsense!  Course it matters.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: ... the Princess Lili... I've killed her.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: She's sore hurt, Jack, tis true, but not dead yet.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The wound is mortal.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Nay.  You've not reckoned with the powers of faerie medicine.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can you save her?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Easily... The question is, can we save ourselves?  Be a shame to win the battle only to lose the war.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't... understand.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: The alicorn, lad.  Come to your senses!  Unless we find Baron Couer de Noir and bring back the horn the world is doomed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The Baron hides in the dark in a passage under the Castle... Quick, give me the dwarf's key... the one which opens any lock...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: In the dark, lad?  Why should he do that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because sunlight will kill him. Quickly now, give me the key.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Sunlight, you say?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  Hurry now, Gump, the key!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Mean you to seek him out below?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not afraid of the dark.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I admire your valor, Jack.  By all means, seek him out... But first, we needs visit the kitchen.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: The kitchen be the most important room in a palace, for if the victuals ain't right, little else is likely to be so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Did you bring me here to sup?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Nay, lad, we're here to collect a weapon you'll need fighting the Baron.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What weapon?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Sunlight.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Plan on carrying some away in a kettle?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Easier than that, Jack.  Screwball!  Fetch me down a couple of them plates.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Will you explain what's going on?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Patience, lad.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hey!  Stop it!  I can't see.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Ah, but you will.  And so will the Baron, when we bring a little light to his dark hideaway.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Can't we move any faster?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Tis a delicate operation, lad. Requires a bit of engineering... Next!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Seems to be some sort of vaulted chamber up ahead...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Don't get too far!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hurry up!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He's getting away!  He was at my mercy!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Never show mercy!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I could have struck off his head just now!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Ever wondered why Jenny Greenteeth said you needed the fastest steed on earth?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sapphire!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Ride like wild fire, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He'll not escape me.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You're on your own... like a true champion.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A good day for singing...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: I've not heard a note out of you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not in the mood, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Listen to him.  Not in the mood...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: On a day like none other the blessed earth has ever seen... A day so fair as forty springtimes --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not denying it's a joyous day --

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Where's your joy if you cannot sing?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Were the Princess Lili to join me I would sing till my lungs burst!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: She lives... isn't that worth singing about?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She lives like all the world before the Baron's curse lifted.  Now the world's reborn, yet still she sleeps...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The quest's at an end and where's the good of it?  A faerie festival over a pile of bones?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Tis not the wound, that's sure.  Not a scar remains... we're talking about a spell; harder to repair than sword-work.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll do anything... face any challenge!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Might not need a gesture quite so grand.  What were you doing the very moment the Baron's curse fell on the world?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I was with the Princess.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: By the pond.  She was teasing me.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Go on... go on...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She tossed her ring in the pond and bid me fetch it.  Said she'd marry me if I did.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: And did you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nay.  It was lost.  When I came up for air the pond was frozen over.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: That's it then... the ring!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You must find the ring... It completes the cycle; answers the riddle...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll try.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You're good at riddles... Find the ring and the spell is broken.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Keep me belly full, Jack.  Kill us another worm.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Hush up, Screwball.  Do your own worm-sticking if you like the taste so well.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Nay.  Jack's the dragon-slayer, ain't you, Jack.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well done, lad.  Stout heart.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Wolf-slayer, worm-sticker... give a cheer for the champion!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Barely living, from the looks of it.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: No, no, no... this is different!

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: You see!  You see!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: These chaps'll need a woodpecker to pick their teeth.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Ogg lives there...!  And Thurgis!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Screwball!  Be quiet...!  We have friends live 'neath the Needle. They'll no doubt provide safe refuge for the night.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: We seek to undo the curse.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Gonna make ogre-stew!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Well done, lad.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Three cheers for our champion.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Look at that shot!  Three at once! I can't miss!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Very thrifty.  Even got your arrow back.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Sweet slippers of Oisin!

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: They've fired the moat!

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Someone like Floki... or Squarefoot... or --

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: You'll do it because I am you liege and I command you to do it!

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Aye... my Lord...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Rise, Screwball, and into the basket with you.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Start acting like you're worthy of this mission... Here.  Whatever you do, don't dare drop it.

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Nay, Sire, I'll cling to it as to life itself...

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Good, lad... Here, Jack, give me a hand with the windlass... There's a good fellow...

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: How're these?

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: They'll do nicely.

turns.speaker: GUMP
turns.text: Dolt!

turns.speaker: SCREWBALL
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Greetings, my lady, the green wood is honored.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, Jack, you are a wild man to use me so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: These for me?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: If you like.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You promised!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: But you did... you did!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I may have said perhaps...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Liar!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Or perchance...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: It's my father, gone a-hunting.  The Baron Couer de Noir is his guest and must be provided with some sport.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sport, indeed.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: The Baron is a frightful man.  They say he's an ogre.  He wears a mask so none may see his face.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Blackheart.  Aptly named.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, fie.  What about the unicorn?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Unicorn?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: A promise is a sacred oath.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right.  I'll show you something sacred.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Let's rest a minute.  I'm so thirsty.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Stop complaining.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: A gentleman would offer water.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Only were he a fool to boot.  See yon viper?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I detest serpents.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That viper has envenomed the water. No animal will drink here now.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What shall we do?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Be patient.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, dear.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I've lost my napkin.  It was all elf-work and lace... I must have dropped it when you startled me so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll go search for it.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Don't leave me now.  I fear the unicorn won't show himself without you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not its master.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: The napkin will keep.  I'd rather not be alone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your command is my wish, Princess Lili.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: How much longer?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Shhh!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I am a princess.  You have no right to order me about.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In these woods you are a commoner. Now be quiet.  True royalty approaches.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Such grace... and their smell; it's ambrosia.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They rival the angels of paradise.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh Jack, mightn't I touch one?  It would thrill me so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Are you honest?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Jack!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tis a fair question.  If you be a virtuous maid the unicorn will lay his head in your lap.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: He'll not flee if I show myself?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not if you be chaste.  Tis an awesome test of virginity.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I've no fear of failure.  Your implications are most unbecoming.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm not your judge... nor have I any desire to witness the trial.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: To fetch your napkin.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I don't know.  They've hurt the unicorn.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: My father and the Baron.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Damned hunters.  It was a trap, and you were the bait!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I didn't know... I didn't...  It was so lovely... he was in my lap like... like a baby... and... I...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They tricked you.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: My own father...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How bad was the unicorn's wound?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: It happened so fast.  He was hurt and ran away.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He did run?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, yes, and the mare with him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Good.  They'll never catch him. There's not a mount in the kingdom can outrun a unicorn.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There are many would pay a king's ransom for a few drops of unicorn blood.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I don't want it on me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Its powers are strong.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I don't want to be reminded of what happened.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Do you think memory can be washed away like a few spots of blood?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not even the birds sing sweet as you.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Jack... Green Jack, you mustn't flatter me so.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tis the truth.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: A maid must beware of flattery... Methinks you want to kiss me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's no happier thought under heaven.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: If I were your bride, would the kissing ever stop...?  Do you wish to marry me, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My lady mocks me.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Nay, Jack, I'm but wary of your intentions.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: My heart intends no more than that you love me as I do you.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh, la...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm afraid it may storm.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Let it.  Haven't you a cozy bower we might hide in?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tis not fit for a princess.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Be it fit for your wife, Green Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I have no wife.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Then, perchance you'll me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: If wishes were horses even beggars would ride.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Do you wish it, Jack?  Wish you this our wedding band?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What if I answer yes?  Will my wish come true?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lili!  No!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Jack... Forgive me...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What have I done?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Only what's right...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I thought you were dead... I --

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I was bewitched... it's better this way...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They told me you were dead.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  I won't let it happen...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You've freed me, Jack...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's the Baron's damnable work!  Too cowardly to stand and fight... he used you to save himself.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: No... it's not you he's afraid of, it's... light...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Sunlight... It destroys him.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sunlight?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: That's why he goes masked during the day...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So, he's hiding in the dark...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: In the dark... where I join him...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!  Don't let go... you mustn't!  I love you!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: And I... love you...

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh!  Green Jack!  What a dream I've had... proper nightmare.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Whilst you were sleeping, I fetched your ring.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Sweet Jack.  I'm so sorry you found me asleep.  Don't know what came over me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I can't have been under much more than a minute.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Seemed like weeks and weeks.  Such a terrible dream... I could never tell you...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Is what you said about the ring but another dream?

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oh no, dearest Jack... I meant every word.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're teasing still.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Nay, dearest Jack... you are to be my husband.  I want none other.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: But... I am a Green Man.  I have no title, nor lands... scarce even a few vines and threads to keep the cold from my body.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: You wear your weeds as well as golden armor, Jack.  Like a true Prince... a champion!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Lili... I love you!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: And I love you, my husband.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: What's the matter?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ouch!  Something's biting me.

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Biting you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Pinching me!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Pinching?  Where?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Everywhere!  Ow!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: I can't see a thing.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nor can I.  Damn!  It's buzzing all around me.  Ouch!  I can hear it like a fly trapped inside my ear... Says its name is Oona!

turns.speaker: LILI
turns.text: Oona?  Do you suppose it's a faerie?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ow!  Whatever it is, it hurts.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Honored to make your acquaintance.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Grand champion, is it?  And what great cause leads you to me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We seek the ogre, Baron Couer de Noir.  He slew a unicorn and plunged the world into eternal winter.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Thought the weather terrible of late.

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Step lively now!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: His feet shall never cross my lips.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sigurd's sword...

turns.speaker: OGG
turns.text: Another hero's hand-me-down... Thurgis, note the armor; tis Greek work.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What's this now?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I bring you the only treasure worthy of your loveliness... for naught else in the universe rivals the reflected glory of your beauty.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Well spoke, boy.  You have discerning taste for one so young... Just who might you be?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They call me Green Jack, ma'am.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Come closer then, Jack, that I might give you proper thanks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Your fair smile be thanks enough. Better I stand afar to admire your beauty complete.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Think me fair, do you, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The moon herself would hide behind a cloud rather than dare comparison with you...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: The moon is too round of face, methinks.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The sight of you makes flowers seem like dross.  All the heavenly angels must envy your grace.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I like well your conceit, Jack.  Tis rare to find an honest lad in this troubled world.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  And it is the trouble befallen us that brings me here.  I entreat you to tell me the cause of our surrounding sorrow, most lovely of the lovely.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Dear lad, what does winter bespeak but death?  It is a time of mourning.  This calamity is a curse. Something wondrous and beautiful has been taken from the world.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: A unicorn's been slain.  The last stallion in all the country.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Why then, there thou hast.  We be lucky worse has not befallen us.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Here be the death weapon; the unicorn's blood dry upon it.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Couer de Noir!  A demon if the Devil ever made one.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: He chopped off the horn and left the rest to rot.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: That would be the Baron's way. There'll be no light or life in the world until the alicorn is taken from him and he vanquished.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How do I get the horn back?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You'll need the fastest steed alive, for Couer de Noir's castle rests at the very edge of the earth.  Only the sharpest sword and the golden armor of Achilles will protect you from his fury.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Where do I find the Baron's castle?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Follow the raven in her flight, Follow old black wing to the edge of night...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not very precise directions.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Come sit beside me, sweet boy, and I'll draw you a map.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nay.  Tempting as your invitation be.  Tell me one thing more.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Ask away, sweet man.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What became of the princess?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Princess?  I know of no princess.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Princess Lili, Godwin's daughter. She was with me when calamity struck, but after I could find no trace of her.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Is she fair, this princess?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Exceeding fair.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: As fair as me?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Twould be to compare one star with another in the summer sky.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: She's dead!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Dead, dead, dead.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Far as you're concerned she's dead, believe it or not.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is sad news, be it true.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Don't be sad, Jack, not with me here to give you cheer.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Tis not the time to speak of cheer.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You'll visit again?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: As a hummingbird returns to the fairest blossom.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What a fine meal you'd make, be the rest of you sweet as your tongue.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Courage, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I pray God grants it me.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: This is not the time for squabbling.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Sorry.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Were I a mortal girl, Jack, methinks I'd be in love with you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then I'd kiss you without turning my garments inside-out and sewing bells all over.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: No need for bells, Jack.  I'll nay enchant ye.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Such a sad world, be there no unicorns to brighten it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No fear of that now.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Never even had a sword in my hand until yesterday.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Then, tis not for chastity? Methought you kept a naked blade twixt you and any maiden chanced spend the night.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I live in an abandoned fox den neath the roots of a thousand-year-old oak.  My bed is pine boughs and rabbit skins.  There's no need of weaponry to keep the maids away.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: I'm partial to oaks, as are all faerie folk.  Mayn't I come visit sometime?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'd be honored.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Only that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And charmed, of course.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Fie!  Don't speak of charms.  I should charm you for being so dull- witted.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I had no thought of offending you, Oona.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Do I not please you, Jack?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: In every way.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: And am I not fair?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wondrously so.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Then why do you speak sweeter words to Jenny Greenteeth?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That was in jest.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Jest with me then.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: How so?

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Tell me I'm fair, as you did the hag.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You are fair as the first new flower of spring...

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: And sweet?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Sweeter than bee pollen on a summer wind.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Pray you be sweet as your words, dear Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nay, Oona, tis not possible.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: A faerie's love makes anything possible.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm promised to another!

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: What shape I take matters not.  Long you for another?  I'll give you your heart's desire.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Oona... don't cry... please, you mustn't...

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: You... you... you mortal you!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: Why should I feel such pain?  Should be the other way round... I could vex you... make you dance your life away...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Threats won't make me love you.  Tis not the way of the human heart.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: What care I for the human heart! Such a soft, spiritless thing it is. I prefer the hearts of hawks and wolves; fierce and free and keen as steel!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: And as barren of love as stone.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: I would build a wall around me with such stone, so the likes of you might never enter.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Be fair, Oona.

turns.speaker: OONA
turns.text: You beware, Jack!  You and your porridge-pot heart!
